fields.description: When you reload a review (using the bottom-right reload popup button), it doesn't calculate the column width of the review contents properly. In most cases this is not noticeable, but when your file only has short lines, you get really wide columns to the left.
fields.summary: Chrome doesn't calculate columns correctly when reload is triggered by user.
Add atlassian-profiling framework to FishEye

fields.description:
If the Owner/Author of a Review is deleted, the Review page shows the "deleted user" icon and the "deleted user" hover activates as expected.

In contrast, in the Dashboard Reviews view the default avatar is being displayed as there's no deleted data making its way through to the front end. Additionally no user hover is present.

Dashboard version needs to be the same as the Review experience

!http://img.skitch.com/20101117-rcbmhipncj33f6bfw5nswjbdx4.jpg!
fields.summary: Dashboard Reviews avatar listing fails when the Review owner is deleted
Path match filter
Diff text match filter
Changeset comment match filter

fields.description: Today, Last week, Last month, custom date range etc.
fields.summary: Add age filter options
Add branch/tag selector repository control
Add repository selector filter control

fields.description: Improve hit highlighting to include better punctuation, case, etc.
fields.summary: Pretty hit highlighting
Add filters for restricting text matches

fields.description: See here for review and comment: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4467#c38396
fields.summary: Fix FindBugs-detected error in BaseRepositoryPresenter.java

fields.description:
Pages replaced by GWT admin:
* repository listing
* repository add / view / edit
* repository defaults
* front page messages
* avatars
fields.summary: Remove admin JSPs and action classes where they have been replaced by GWT admin

fields.description: This is a regression (at least from 2.3, not sure when it happened).
fields.summary: Latest Comment field n a crucible review is double-escaped
changeset view: when a file has a really long name/path the options overflow covering content

fields.description: Red team will be adding merges to activity stream for DVCS (CRUC-4807).  We need to add a visual design to the new activity stream page to show these events.
fields.summary: Display Merges in Activity Stream

fields.summary: Reduce logging cruft for IOExceptions encountered whilst accessing JIRA
Ensure that the feonly func tests are running on beac

fields.description:
The EAC/C logs are littered with exceptions like the following - that occur when a user doesn't have sufficient permissions to access a particular issue (or if the issue doesn't exists).

We should reduce this to a one line WARN

fields.summary: Upgrade FECRU to support com.atlassian.event 2.0

fields.description: See the attached screenshot.  The Latest Comment view on a review doesn't appear to escape quotes properly.  I wasn't able to reproduce this on 2.4.1, but I can on 2.4.2.  I can reproduce this on Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Latest Comment string is not properly escaped

fields.description:
One of our users uploaded an animated gif file for his avatar.  The fisheye.out and fisheye-error.log files had 133 lines of error messages every 10 seconds until he installed a non-animated file 6 hours later.  When I noticed this the log files were over 6 MG.  Had he not installed a good file the log files would have continued to grow and eventually could fill a system.

Documentation should include a notice to NOT use an animated image.  Some type of alert to the user or administrator would be good.  Email notification or something to inform the user and/or admin that there is a problem.
fields.summary: WARNING - do not use animated gif files for avatar

fields.description:
This was happening when a committer used one capitalisation to commit (eg BobSmith) then later replaced lines using another capitalisation (bobsmith), so in the second commit the net loc change for Bob Smith was 0.  The ClassCastException is deceptive, its more like a ConcurrentModificationException. 

{code}
Java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Object cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.bucket.ParameterSetInsertion.checkAuthors(ParameterSetInsertion.java:71)

fields.description:
Since the release of 2.4.x, customers have been reporting numerous GWT errors when accessing the Admin console.  These errors seem to mainfest themselves in a dialog box in the UI, but only seem to mask some underlying problem that's usually occurring with repository indexing or some other error.

For example:

*Stack trace 1*
{noformat}
2010-11-12 04:14:35,782 ERROR [btpool0-10] fisheye.app com.atlassian.fecru.gwt.core.server.LoggingRPCServiceImpl-error - Failed to load administration panel:com.google.gwt.core.client.impl.AsyncFragmentLoader$HttpDownloadFailure: HTTP download failed with status 206
Unknown.G6b(Unknown source:0)
Unknown.b7b(Unknown source:0)
Unknown.anonymous(Unknown source:0)
Unknown.i7b(Unknown source:0)
Unknown.anonymous(Unknown source:0)
Unknown.anonymous(Unknown source:0)
2010-11-12 04:17:21,956 ERROR [btpool0-15] fisheye
{noformat}

*Stack trace 2*
{noformat}
Error calling server:com.atlassian.fecru.gwt.admin.shared.OperationFailureException: Repository took too long to stop, you may need to start it manually. Unknown.kGb(Unknown source:0) Unknown.qGb(Unknown source:0) Unknown.LPc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.os(Unknown source:0) Unknown.uNc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.oOc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.$bc(Unknown source:0)
{noformat}

*Stack trace 3*
{noformat}
Error calling server:com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.StatusCodeException: The call failed on the server; see server log for details Unknown.PJc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.oOc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.$bc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.Ccc(Unknown source:0) Unknown.<anonymous>(Unknown source:0) Unknown.s2b(Unknown source:0) Unknown.onreadystatechange(Unknown source:0)
{noformat}

*Stack trace 4*
{noformat}
Error calling server:com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.StatusCodeException: 500 The call failed on the server; see server log for details
{noformat}

*Stack trace 5*
The JVM used by FishEye has been moved/removed and is not accessible:
{noformat}
WARN  [qtp1171802656-1523 ] / ContextHandler$Context-log - Exception while dispatching incoming RPC call
com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.UnexpectedException: Service method 'public abstract com.atlassian.fecru.gwt.admin.shared.repositories.RepositoryInitData com.atlassian.fecru.gwt.admin.client.RepositoryAdminRpcService.getRepositoryInitData() throws com.atlassian.fecru.gwt.admin.shared.AuthorizationException' threw an unexpected exception: java.lang.InternalError: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /usr/java/jdk1.8.0_60/jre/lib/charsets.jar

fields.summary: Better handling of GWT issues in Admin console

fields.description:
Currently, the My Reviews dashboard is geared toward reviewers only as it provides quick links to reviews where you are a reviewer, but not an author or moderator

We would like to see a similar dashboard, but for Crucible users who may be a Moderator or author as well.
The current dashboard can be confusing for those users who are a reviewer, author or moderator, as the To Review link only returns reviews that they need to complete as reviewers. This link does not show reviews where they are authors or possibly moderators where they need to complete the review.

The Custom Filter is a work-around for providing these results, but a dashboard would be very handy especially for those users who only may be an author or moderator.
fields.summary: Provide a Review dashboard per review role

fields.description:
A customer claims that their Git repository is not able to show the commit activity. By looking into the log, this is shown which could be causing the problem:

{noformat}
...
2010-11-10 06:14:51,450 ERROR [IncrementalPinger1] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.OneOffPingRequest-doRequest - Exception during slurp
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.cenqua.fisheye.bucket.ParameterSetInsertion.checkAuthors(ParameterSetInsertion.java:83)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.bucket.ParameterSetInsertion.<init>(ParameterSetInsertion.java:38)
at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseLinecountCalculator.getParameterSetInsertion(BaseLinecountCalculator.java:141)
...
{noformat}

We need some further investigation on this and thanks for the helps! :)

Cheers,

fields.description:
and theyre unnecessary - it only needs the paths, not the revisions

we should:
* build up an index I_LOGICALPATHID_PATHID
* get all physical paths for a logical path and return only those paths that map to the branch using the pathMatcher

then it can also be used for tags

reference: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-4400#c37655

fields.description: By default when you configure SSL in FECRU 2.4.x, it will continue listening on the non-SSL port for connections.  We should be able to provide the ability to force all connections over SSL so that if users don't access Fisheye via the regular port.
fields.summary: Provide the option to force SSL
FishEye dialogue sends user to URL escaped URL

fields.summary: Add UPM to FishEye

fields.description:
Adding the newest revision of and outdated file to a review changes the view mode back to 3 lines

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1) Open a file for review
2) Click View -> Full context
3) Click the File outdated button and then Add latest

The View mode changes back to 3 lines (even though I have Full context set as my default view mode). It gets very annoying as I have to switch back to Full context every time.
fields.summary: Revert back to 3 line context, even if you have Full Context set as default

fields.summary: Test Connection message on JIRA Server configuration is shown as an error when successful

fields.description:
From forums customer at http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=48783&tstart=0

From the documentation of the (very useful) changeset discussion feature, it says notifications are only shown up in the comments team, sent to the change author, or sent in reply to a comment.

The problem we have is you have to be in a discussion to see it.

What my team has asked for is email notifications of any comment on a changelist covered by an existing watch. Within a team, they want to know when a discussion is taking place, but to be notified of this rather than having to hunt for it. Appearing in the activity stream is not good enough as it is too passive, and discussions can easily get pushed off the front page.

In other words, have an option (default on) to get notifications of discussion activity on a watched area in addition to submission events.

Ideally this would be a feature request. But in the meantime, is there any other mechanism I can use?
fields.summary: Add ability to subscribe to changeset discussion activity
Upgrade to JIRA Blockers 1.6.9

fields.description:
Activity Streams 3.x relied on the {{Notification}} class to generate stream entries [1]. As we intend to deploy Streams 4.x as a plugins 2 plugin, we need an alternative way to generate entries efficiently. Nothing in the API exists to do this at the moment. After chatting with Tim P., we decided that exposing the {{LogManager}} to the API might be the best way to go about this.

[1] https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/STRM-252
fields.summary: Expose LogManager to Crucible API

fields.description:
Create a review with the latest version of file changes then attempt to add older versions from a previous changeset.

The older changeset remains selected in the Add Content dialog, but there's no change in the UI

You need to reload the page for the changes to appear. This is in contrast to adding new revisions to an existing review.
fields.summary: Adding older, rather than newer file versions, requires a manual page reload for the changes to appear

fields.description: We have lost the ability to "favourite" things with the 2.4 redesign!  Please add a star back to the right side of the grey navbar (or some other appropriate location)
fields.summary: Return the ability to add "favourites"
when you hit "Reload" after someone added comments, it jumps you to the top of the frx you are viewing
